vulnerabilities.title: Withdrawn Advisory: bun vulnerable to OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
### Withdrawn Advisory
This advisory has been withdrawn because it does not describe a vulnerability in Bun itself. See the following rejection message from the CVE Numbering Authority:

> Rejected reason: Bun Shell does not invoke /bin/sh, or any other interpreter, for template literals created with the $ function. Each ${â€¦} interpolation is treated as a single argument. The security responsibility for this usage pattern lies with the calling application, which must ensure the sanitization and

vulnerabilities.title: Bun has an Application-level Prototype Pollution vulnerability in the runtime native API for Glo
vulnerabilities.description: Versions of the package bun before 1.1.30 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution due to improper input sanitization. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability through Bun's APIs that accept objects.
